Operation 'searchStickers' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. The current description explains what the operation does but lacks clarity about expected inputs (search parameters) and outputs (paginated sticker collection). Added specific parameter types and return value structure to improve AI agent interpretability and help agents understand what data to provide and expect.

data.current_description: Replicates the functionality and requirements of the classic GIPHY search, but returns animated stickers rather than GIFs.
data.description_suggestion: Search for animated stickers by query term. Accepts search parameters including query string, limit, offset, and rating filters. Returns a paginated collection of sticker objects matching the search criteria, with metadata about the total results available and pagination details.
data.reasoning: The current description explains what the operation does but lacks clarity about expected inputs (search parameters) and outputs (paginated sticker collection). Added specific parameter types and return value structure to improve AI agent interpretability and help agents understand what data to provide and expect.

message: Operation 'translateSticker' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, unclear_purpose. Original description uses vague language ('special sauce') and incorrectly mentions GIFs instead of stickers. Missing clarity on inputs (phrase parameter), outputs (single sticker result), and the operation's unique purpose (semantic translation vs. search). Improved version clarifies the semantic matching behavior, specifies single-result return, and explains when to use this versus search for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: The translate API draws on search, but uses the GIPHY `special sauce` to handle translating from one vocabulary to another. In this case, words and phrases to GIFs.
data.description_suggestion: Translates a text phrase or word into a single best-matching animated sticker using GIPHY's semantic matching algorithm. Accepts a search phrase as input and returns a single sticker object that best represents the phrase semantically. Useful for converting natural language queries into visual sticker representations without requiring explicit search.
data.reasoning: Original description uses vague language ('special sauce') and incorrectly mentions GIFs instead of stickers. Missing clarity on inputs (phrase parameter), outputs (single sticker result), and the operation's unique purpose (semantic translation vs. search). Improved version clarifies the semantic matching behavior, specifies single-result return, and explains when to use this versus search for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'trendingStickers' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details. data.current_description: Fetch Stickers currently trending online. Hand curated by the GIPHY editorial team. Returns 25 results by default.
data.description_suggestion: Fetch currently trending animated stickers curated by the GIPHY editorial team. Accepts optional parameters for limit (default 25), offset for pagination, and rating filters. Returns a paginated collection of trending sticker objects with metadata about total available results and current pagination position.
data.reasoning: Current description mentions the default result count but lacks detail about available parameters and the structure of the response. Added information about pagination support, optional parameters (limit, offset, rating), and clarified that results are returned as a paginated collection with metadata, enabling AI agents to properly construct requests and interpret responses.

data.current_description: A multiget version of the get GIF by ID endpoint.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve multiple GIFs by their IDs
data.description_suggestion: Fetches multiple GIF objects in a single request by providing a comma-separated list of GIF IDs. Returns an array of Gif objects matching the provided IDs. This is the batch version of the single GIF retrieval endpoint, allowing efficient retrieval of multiple GIFs without making separate requests.
data.reasoning: Original description is too vague and doesn't explain input format (comma-separated IDs), expected output structure, or use case. Added clarity about batch retrieval capability and parameter format for better AI agent understanding.

Description lacked clarity about return value (single Gif object) and use cases. Enhanced to specify return type and clarify the optional nature of tag filtering for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Returns a random GIF, limited by tag. Excluding the tag parameter will return a random GIF from the GIPHY catalog.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a random GIF with optional tag filtering
data.description_suggestion: Returns a single random GIF from the GIPHY catalog. Optionally filter results by tag to narrow the selection. When no tag is specified, returns a random GIF from the entire GIPHY catalog. Returns a single Gif object. Useful for applications requiring unpredictable GIF content.
data.reasoning: Summary was too generic. Description lacked clarity about return value (single Gif object) and use cases. Enhanced to specify return type and clarify the optional nature of tag filtering for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Search all GIPHY GIFs for a word or phrase. Punctuation will be stripped and ignored.  Use a plus or url encode for phrases. Example paul+rudd, ryan+gosling or american+psycho.
data.summary_suggestion: Search GIPHY catalog for GIFs by keyword or phrase
data.description_suggestion: Searches the GIPHY catalog for GIFs matching a word or phrase. Punctuation is automatically stripped and ignored. Use plus signs or URL encoding for multi-word phrases (e.g., paul+rudd, ryan+gosling). Returns a paginated array of Gif objects matching the search query. Supports offset and limit parameters for pagination control.
data.reasoning: Summary was too vague. Description lacked information about return type (paginated Gif array) and pagination parameters. Added clarity about output structure and pagination support to help AI agents understand result handling.

data.current_description: The translate API draws on search, but uses the GIPHY `special sauce` to handle translating from one vocabulary to another. In this case, words and phrases to GIF
data.summary_suggestion: Translate text phrase to most relevant GIF
data.description_suggestion: Converts a text phrase or word into the most contextually relevant GIF using GIPHY's semantic matching algorithm. Unlike standard search, this endpoint intelligently interprets meaning to find the best matching GIF rather than keyword matching. Returns a single Gif object representing the best match for the input phrase. Useful for applications requiring semantic GIF selection based on user intent.
data.reasoning: Original description was vague and used informal language ('special sauce'). Lacked clarity about return value and how it differs from search. Improved to explain semantic matching capability, return type (single Gif), and differentiation from search functionality for better AI agent interpretability.
